TopicTitle: How close to reality does FAR + Real Solar System get you?

Articles.Content: So I've been messing around with FAR and the Real Solar System Mods in an attempt to get a better Idea on how hard it is to actually get a rocket to orbit. However I had noticed that I have had to use rockets whose sizes dwarf those of actual reality can hardly get anything in orbit if anything at all!!! So I am wondering how close to reality do these mods get you? Is it actually harder with this layout or do I just need ALOT more practice??

I think you need to apply a re-balance patch for mass of items and fuel densities. Everything in KSP is several times denser than it would be in real life; you're effectively trying to launch rockets made out of solid osmium, which doesn't work so great with a realistically-sized Kerbin.

That would Explain why this could barley get this shuttle into orbit...

Its like 13 falcon 9's lifting an 18 ton load to LEO...
I had a Falcon 9 Heavy that got like 1/10 of the real one to orbit.
Well, another issue with your rocket design is that your CoL is now above your CoM, and if you lose control, its really hard to turn out of because we dont have huge gimbal range engines.

If you want to build somewhat realistic rockets under FAR+RSS you need to install the Realism Overhaul and associated mods, most especially RealFuels. You'll then achieve fairly realistic mass fractions (some 2% to orbit, IIRC).

This is the best rocket i've done this far

About 26 tons to TLI

I managed to get 170 tons into orbit last night.

I used a rocket five times heavier than a Saturn V.

So....... something's not right

Pretty damn close, actually. Add Orbital Manipulator, RealFuels, RT2 and TAC to that and you're basically set!

Edited April 26, 2014 by KvickFlygarn87
added realfuels

This rocket would get about 15-25 tons into orbit, and was about half the weight of the Saturn V.

Also, here is said Falcon 9 Heavy with a lunar probe:

I suspect the poor tankage for the stock tanks is a big part of a problem. The S-1C had a wet:dry mass ratio of over 17:1, and I believe that figure includes the engines. KSP tanks are 9:1 for the 1.25 and 2.5m tanks by themselves, and 8.2:1 for the ARM tanks

Only those 2 mods won't get you very close to realism. You will need to download RealFuels, EngineIgnitor, Realism Overhaul, DRE,Rfts engine pack or the Real Engines engine pack,StrechySRB (now in PP) and a part mod (KW rocketry and AIES). Those mods (With RSS and FAR) will bring the experience close to the real one.

I doesn't take ages to have any fun, I'm indeed having even more fun than with any non-RSS install. The game was supposed to be mod able which means that mods are supposed to be.
